relevant_findings.initial_findings: Hypocalcemia with serum calcium of 6.5 mg/dl and hyperphosphatemia with serum phosphate of 5.2 mg/dl at first presentation
relevant_findings.ongoing_findings: After treatment, serum calcium remained normal at 8.4 mg/dl (2.1 mmol/liter) and 8.3 mg/dl (2.07 mmol/liter) for 6 months.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient's serum calcium levels dropped to 7.8 mg/dl (1.95 mmol/liter), while serum phosphate was 4.4 mg/dl (1.42 mmol/liter), and PTH rose to 653 pg/ml after the temporary discontinuation of calcium and vitamin D.

relevant_findings.initial_findings: The patient had a mild degree of osteopenia (T-score, -0.9) on a bone density scan of the lumbar spine.
relevant_findings.ongoing_findings: The proband's sister's bone density scan showed mild osteopenia (T-score, -1.35) but no changes over time.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Hypocalcemia in the proband was initially problematic, but after treatment, stable serum calcium levels were observed for six months until a drop was noted.
